page.title: 01Local History
page.content: Harbottle during the Middle Ages, when England and Scotland were separate kingdoms, was with Norham a major stronghold in Northumberland - more important even than Newcastle. After the Union,the castle was used as a "quarry" for the new Harbottle Castle. The area is mainly involved in farming, the chief interest being in sheep,with some cattle and the production of crops such as barley and turnips to support them.The south-west of the area is moorland and forestry. The working population which was intensive in agriculture has now greatly reduced because of modern methods and mechanisation. Because of better transport facilities,people can now travel away for their work and leissure.
